prompts.deleteMessageMultiple: {count} adet dosyayı silmek istediğinize emin misiniz?
prompts.deleteMessageSingle: Dosya ya da dizini silmek istediğinize emin misiniz?
prompts.downloadMessage: İndirmek için bir dosya biçimi seçiniz.
prompts.moveMessage: Choose new house for your file(s)/folder(s):
prompts.newDirMessage: Write the name of the new directory.
prompts.newFileMessage: Write the name of the new file.
prompts.replaceMessage: One of the files you're trying to upload is conflicting because of its name. Do you wish to replace the existing one?
prompts.scheduleMessage: Gönderinin yayınlanacağı günü ve saati planlayın.
prompts.newArchetype: Bir arketip üzerine yeni bir içerik yaratın. Yaratılan dosya içerik dizininde yer alacaktır.

settings.brandingHelp:
You can costumize how your File Browser instance looks and feels by changing its name, replacing the logo, adding custom styles and even disable external links to GitHub.
For more information about custom branding, please check out the {0}.
settings.allowEdit: Edit, rename and delete files or directories
settings.commandRunnerHelp: Here you can set commands that are executed in the named events. You must write one per line. The environment variables {0} and {1} will be available, being {0} relative to {1}. For more information about this feature and the available environment variables, please read the {2}.
settings.lockPassword: Prevent the user from changing the password
settings.permissionsHelp: You can set the user to be an administrator or choose the permissions individually. If you select "Administrator", all of the other options will be automatically checked. The management of users remains a privilege of an administrator.
settings.ruleExample1: prevents the access to any dot file (such as .git, .gitignore) in every folder.
settings.ruleExample2: blocks the access to the file named Caddyfile on the root of the scope.
settings.rulesHelp: Here you can define a set of allow and disallow rules for this specific user. The blocked files won't show up in the listings and they wont be accessible to the user. We support regex and paths relative to the users scope.
settings.userCommandsHelp: A space separated list with the available commands for this user. Example:
settings.globalRules: This is a global set of allow and disallow rules. They apply to every user. You can define specific rules on each user's settings to override this ones.
settings.createUserDir: Auto create user home dir while adding new user
settings.defaultUserDescription: This are the default settings for new users.
settings.executeOnShellDescription: By default, File Browser executes the commands by calling their binaries directly. If you want to run them on a shell instead (such as Bash or PowerShell), you can define it here with the  required arguments and flags. If set, the command you execute will be appended as an argument. This apply to both user commands and event hooks.

perm.rename: Rename or move files and directories
